base noun
(BOTTOM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C ] the bottom part of an object, on which it rests, or the lowest part of something: a crystal glass with a heavy base At the base of the cliff was a rocky beach. This cream provides an excellent base for your make-up (= a good bottom layer on which other layers can be put).
More examplesFewer examplesDraw a perpendicular from the vertex of the triangle to its base.Firefighters played their hoses onto the base of the fire.Sand carried by the wind has hollowed out the base of the cliff.The doctor manipulated the base of my spine and the pain disappeared completely.The base of the bed was made of slats.
